title: RigVeda Hymn 10169

Rig Veda, tr. by Ralph T.H. Griffith, [1896], at sacred-texts.com

HYMN CLXIX. COWS.

1. MAY the wind blow upon our Cows with healing: may they eat herbage full of vigorous juices.
May they drink waters rich in life and fatness: to food that moves on feet be gracious, Rudra.
2 Like-coloured, various-hued, or single-coloured, whose names through sacrifice are known to Agni,
Whom the Aṅgirases produced by Fervour,—vouchsafe to these, Parjanya, great protection.
3 Those who have offered to the Gods their bodies, whose varied forms are all well known to Soma,—
Those grant us in our cattle-pen, O Indra, with their full streams of milk and plenteous offspring.
4 Prajāpati, bestowing these upon me, one-minded with all Gods and with the Fathers,
Hath to our cow-pen brought auspicious cattle: so may we own the offspring they will bear us.

Next: HYMN CLXX. Sūrya.

data.title: HYMN CLXIX. COWS.
data.describe: MAY the wind blow upon our Cows with healing.
data.feecting:
p:MAY the wind blow upon our Cows with healing. May they eat herbage full of vigorous juices.
p: May they drink waters rich in life and fatness: to food that moves on feet be gracious, Soma.
p:Like-coloured, various-hued, or single-coloured, whose names through offering are known to Agni, whom the Aṅgirases produced by Fervour,—vouchsafe to these, Parjanya, great protection.
p:Those who have offered to the Devas their bodies, whose varied forms are all well known to Soma,— Those grant us in our cattle-pen, O Indra, with their full streams of milk and plenteous offspring.
p:Prajāpati, bestowing these upon me, one-minded with all Devas and with the Fathers, Hath to our cow-pen brought auspicious cattle: s. May we own the offspring they will bear us.
